thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic: Football fan offers $3,000 to be ManU star's mascot
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic: Football fan offers $3,000 to be ManU star's mascot

author: Pulse News Agency International By AFP
title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic: Football fan offers $3,000 to be ManU star's mascot
text:
24/7 Live - Subscribe to the Pulse Newsletter! Subscribe 24/7 Live - Subscribe to the Pulse Newsletter! Back to Article A mystery fan offered Russian side Rostov a bribe of nearly $3,000 to allow his son to lead Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic onto the pitch as a mascot in next week's Europa League clash. "Yesterday a man called the club and offered 170,000 rubles for his son to lead out Ibrahimovic," Rostov spokesman Ivan Bodylevsky wrote on Twitter. "What are (some) people ready to do." Bodylevsky said the club had never accepted money in exchange for a child to serve as a mascot. Last season's Russian league runners-up, Rostov stunned German giants Bayern Munich during the Champions League group stage to finish a surprise third and continue their European adventure in the Europa League. Rostov thrashed Czech outfit Sparta Prague 5-1 on aggregate in the last 32 to set up an enticing showdown with Jose Mourinho's Manchester United. The first leg takes place in Rostov next Thursday with the return leg to be played in Manchester on March 16. Tweet Author
